pullRequest.body:
replace the assumption `NormedAddCommGroup` to `SemiNormedAddCommGroup` in various places.

motivation: with the weakened assumption the results apply to `InnerProductSpace` without `definite` assumption.

This is suggested in #16707, and continues from #14024.

---

I think it should be possible to do the same with `IsSymmetric.restrictScalars` but `CompatibleSMul E E ‚Ñù ùïú` cannot be synthesized. Can anyone help?

Are there other things that work with `SemiNormedAddCommGroup`?

I noticed that in [InnerProductSpace.Basic](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/InnerProductSpace/Basic.html#InnerProductSpace) there are two instances of `InnerProductSpace ‚Ñù ‚ÑÇ`. Should I remove the latter?

### PR summary [0f88afc31f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17007/commits/0f88afc31f0d03b53d2f49c5efaab2905726f69f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b699ae39-6b04-4d8b-b5c7-1aaccc820998) for commit 94fe59e1b2a807158344426392c5e570e49eca40.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/e20c0e1f-4811-4904-8a2e-2d501706f872/to/b699ae39-6b04-4d8b-b5c7-1aaccc820998) against commit 831db37825f191f25bccb2603532b4b29e931a57.
I span off #17011 from this; I think that in turn will make some sections more generalizable.

> this is suggested in #16707. I think it should be possible to do the same with `IsSymmetric.restrictScalars` but `CompatibleSMul E E ‚Ñù ùïú` cannot be synthesized. Can anyone help?

I managed to solve this for you with a `letI`.

Yes, I only checked `Basic`, `Symmetric` and `Dual`. I will see whether more generalizations are possible in other files when I will use them. Thank you very much for your help!

Could you please tell me why `#synth CompatibleSMul E E ‚Ñù ùïú` cannot be synthesized, yet the previous code worked with `NormedAddCommGroup`?

@yoh-tanimoto I think Eric already explained this above. The issue is that the instance it was trying to use required `T2Space`, which doesn't hold in seminormed spaces, only normed ones. So it needed explicit help.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11040901685/job/30669959204)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11040901685/job/30669959843)

> @yoh-tanimoto I think Eric already explained this above. The issue is that the instance it was trying to use required `T2Space`, which doesn't hold in seminormed spaces, only normed ones. So it needed explicit help.

Actually the issue here was more subtle; the lemma was about a non-instance typeclass argument provided through a messy `@ _ _ _` invocation. I switched this to use `letI` for clarify, but you would need the same `letI` in the `#synth` for it to work.
Yes, I meant that. Even with `NormedAddCommGroup`, I got `#synth` error (as in my question above).

This now looks good to me; I think there are probably more generalizations possible elsewhere, but this already hits quite a lot of them!

Were there any more you wanted help with, or can the `help-wanted` label go?

This now looks good to me; I think there are probably more generalizations possible elsewhere, but this already hits quite a lot of them!

Were there any more you wanted help with, or can the `help-wanted` label go?
This theorem generalizes too after #17011

It seems that there is a problem with `HasStrictFDerivAt` in #17011. I don't really understand why the changes affect it as `HasStrictFDerivAt` has all `NormedAddCommGroup` in the assumption... Should I wait until it is resolved, correct?
I've pushed a fix to that PR
I saw it, and I'm afraid I'm not yet skilled enough to understand the fix... Could you explain briefly what was the issue and how you worked it around?

The issue is that Lean was previously able to guess various arguments, but after that change no longer is. This is usually because it guesses them via unification (matching up terms to fill in the gaps).

Generalizing to seminormed additive groups means that the general seminormed theorems when used in the less-general normed context are now instantiated with `NormedAddCommGroup.toSeminormedAddCommGroup` or `SeminormedRing.toSeminormedAddCommGroup` instead of `inst` or `NormedRing.toNormedAddCommGroup`, and for whatever reason this stifle's Lean's ability to guess.

The `(E := E)`-style fixes are telling Lean "don't guess, here's the answer". The `:)` fixes are telling Lean "please finalize all your guesses now, no looking outside the brackets to help as this might confuse you).

It's very plausible that there is a Lean bug hiding here, but correctly handling unification and synthesis is a very complex can of worms that isn't worth opening on small annoyances like the ones that came up here.

OK... could you please give a reference where I can find these notations? And it seems that there is an issue with the latest commit with a similar nature.

As for `IsSymmetric.restrictScalars`, I have no idea what is failing, because it fails to synthesize `CompatibleSMul E E ‚Ñù ùïú` if I change the assumption to `SemiNormedAddCommGroup` but this has nothing to do with norm. When the placeholder is filled in by Lean, is there any way to see what is put there?

Yes, you can see it by doing `#synth CompatibleSMul E E ‚Ñù ùïú` (in the context where it worked, before the variables were generalized).

I think the thing that `#synth` finds is one that relies on `T2Space E`, which is equivalent to the space being normed and not seminormed. I think I saw something analogous in my last commit, and the fix was `letI : IsScalarTower ‚Ñù ùïú E := RestrictScalars.isScalarTower _ _ _` which amounts to "find a different instance elsewhere".

I see, that command seems very useful, thank you!

However, if I put `#synth CompatibleSMul E E ‚Ñù ùïú` just below `IsSymmetric.restrictScalars`, I get `failed to synthesize SMul ‚Ñù E`... I also get the same with the following MWE.

```lean4
import Mathlib

variable {ùïú E : Type*} [RCLike ùïú] [NormedAddCommGroup E] [InnerProductSpace ùïú E]

open RCLike
open ComplexConjugate
open LinearMap

#synth CompatibleSMul E E ‚Ñù ùïú
```
I've done a much more thorough version of this in #17059, but they can be merged in either order.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Analysis/InnerProductSpace): weaken assumptions to `SeminormedAddCommGroup`

source.title: feat(Analysis/InnerProductSpace/Quotient): add the quotient `InnerProductSpace` by the null space
